name: NAV (USD)
description: Dollar value of crypto assets (does not include cash)

name: Treasury Holdings
description: Number of tokens held by the company. See crypto-asset for asset indicator

name: Price (USD)
description: The average token price during the specified time period for the native asset of that chain.

name: Base Fees (USD)
description: The minimum transaction fee required for a transaction to be included in a block

name: Priority Fees (ETH)
description: An additional transaction fee to incentivize validators to prioritize and execute transactions.

name: Enterprise Value
description: Actual enterprise value for the equity. Calculated as market cap - liabilities + assets

name: Priority Fees (ETH)
description: An additional transaction fee to incentivize validators to prioritize and execute transactions.

name: REV
description: Network REV (Real Economic Value) is a standardized metric that tracks blockchain value accrual generated by user activity. REV consists of both in-protocol transaction fees and out-of-protocol tips that users pay for transaction execution, so it measures the monetary demand to transact onchain.

name: Revenue (USD)
description: The revenue produced during the specified time period for given project.

name: Launchpad Tokens Graduated
description: Token graduated during the specified time period for given launchpad.

name: ETF Flows
description: ETF flows for Grayscale Ethereum Mini Trust ETF (ETH)

name: Burn
description: The total amount of the native token burned transaction fees.

name: REV
description: Network REV (Real Economic Value) is a standardized metric that tracks blockchain value accrual generated by user activity. REV consists of both in-protocol transaction fees and out-of-protocol tips that users pay for transaction execution, so it measures the monetary demand to transact onchain.

name: Revenue (USD)
description: The revenue produced during the specified time period for given project.

name: Fee Median (ETH)
description: Median of the sum of the base fee and priority fee that day

name: Fee Median (SOL)

description: An additional transaction fee to incentivize validators to prioritize and execute transactions.

name: Transactions (Total)
description: Daily number of all transactions.

name: Other Fees (USD)
description: For Ethereum, this includes just blob fees: an additional fee for transactions that post data to "blobs," which are specialized data availability solutions for L2 blockchains.

name: ETF Flows
description: ETF flows for Grayscale Ethereum Trust ETF (ETHE)

name: Volume
description: USD volume over the period

name: Fee Median (USD)
description: Median of the sum of the base fee and priority fee in USD that day

name: Application Revenue (USD)
description: The total amount of revenue produced by all labelled applications during the specified time period for given blockchain.

name: Revenue (USD)
description: The revenue produced during the specified time period for given project.

name: MEV Tips
description: Additional fees for using out-of-protocol systems that enables users to send transactions, or a bundle of transactions, to block builders or leaders for faster transaction execution, MEV capture, or MEV protection.

name: NAV (USD)
description: Dollar value of crypto assets (does not include cash)

name: Enterprise Value (USD)
description: Actual enterprise value for the equity. Calculated as market cap - liabilities + assets

name: REV (USD)
description: Network REV (Real Economic Value) is a standardized metric that tracks blockchain value accrual generated by user activity. REV consists of both in-protocol transaction fees and out-of-protocol tips that users pay for transaction execution, so it measures the monetary demand to transact onchain.

name: Issuance
description: Newly issued tokens that are distributed to participants (such as validators, miners, or stakers) as compensation for participating in consensus.
